summary:
The president, or POTUS, is the leader of the United States. They are in charge of the government's executive branch and the military. The president's power has grown since George Washington, with big increases in the 20th century. They make important decisions about laws, appoint officials, and handle foreign affairs.

The president is elected every four years by the Electoral College. They can only serve two terms, thanks to the 22nd Amendment. Joe Biden is the current president, taking office in 2021.
title: President of the United States
